explanation: [0-0] On a cement floor, there is a silver basin filled with sand.

[0-6] First, a right hand picks up a rusty bolt and nut, places them horizontally in the middle right side of the sand, and presses them into the sand with a stick. The bolt and nut are removed, leaving an indentation in the sand. The same process is repeated on the middle left side of the sand. Then, the bolt and nut are pressed vertically into the sand above and below the center, creating four indentations.

[6-10] Next, a right hand picks up a wrench from the lower right corner and places it diagonally on the sand. Using a stick, the wrench is hammered into the sand, leaving an indentation. This action is repeated, creating a second wrench indentation in the sand.

[10-19] Subsequently, a right hand presses a round plate with a hole in the center onto the sand, surrounded by the previous indentations of the bolt, nut, and wrenches. A stick is used to hammer the plate into the sand, then it's removed, leaving a larger indentation. From the upper right corner, a bowl filled with molten metal is slowly poured into all the indentations in the sand until they are full.
